snippet: Mrs. Brady campaigned side by side with her husband against the gun lobby, often pushing him in his wheelchair, but she was propelled into action when her 5-year-old son found a loaded .22 pistol and pointed it at her.
abstract: Sarah Brady, wife of former White House press secretary James S Brady; dies at age 73; she became a tireless advocate for gun control after her husband was shot and left partly paralyzed in 1981 attempted assassination of Pres Ronald Reagan.
lead_paragraph: Mrs. Brady campaigned side by side with her husband against the gun lobby, often pushing him in his wheelchair, but she was propelled into action when her 5-year-old son found a loaded .22 pistol and pointed it at her.
